meanings.sent1: After the storm passed, they decided to reoccupy their damaged house.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers were ordered to reoccupy the strategic hill they had lost.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to reoccupy its favorite spot on the sunny windowsill, but the dog beat it to it.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts would often reoccupy the memories of her childhood summers spent by the lake.
meanings.sent5: The students were excited to reoccupy their classroom after the long summer break.

meanings.definition: To move back into a place previously occupied
meanings.sent1: The family decided to reoccupy their old farmhouse after renovating it.
meanings.sent2: The tenants were happy to reoccupy their apartment after the repairs were done.
meanings.sent3: The birds quickly reoccupied the birdhouse once the squirrel finally left.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the shadows seemed to reoccupy the empty streets.
meanings.sent5: The children were eager to reoccupy the playground after the rain stopped.
